Event.PageTitle: Vedic Chanting and Sanskrit play - London, April 2013
Event.MetaKeywords: vedic chanting, sanskrit play, bhavan Centre
Event.MetaDescription: Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan London presents Vedic Chanting and Sanskrit play in London, United Kingdom. Don't miss this opportunity to witness a Sanskrit play in a traditional way.
Event.Address: Then Bhavan Centre, 4a Castletown Road, West Kensington, London W14 9HE.
Event.Maindescription:
Saakshii Shillaa was originally written in Kannada, is translated into Sanskrit by Dr HVS Shastry. The play will incorporate dance and drama with commentary in English between acts.

If you missed it at the Southbank earlier this month, do not make the same mistake again. Back by popular demand, Sanskrit play Saakshii Shillaa: Witness Rock which took the Alchemy Festival by storm and was watched by no less than one thousand people, will be performed once again in the second half of this event.

The first half of the programme will explain the beauty, content and styles of vedic recitations by experts from India. Conducted by M.N Chandrashekhara, Vidvan M.S Ramesh Avadhani and Vidvan Subhanu Saxena.

Professor Chandrashekhara and Vidvan Ramesh Avadhani hail from a community of Vedic scholars; Vidvan Subhanu Saxena is a leading executive at one of the world's largest companies and an authority on Vedanta. There will also be dance interpretation of Vedic hymns.
